Railroading of "Proposal on Rice Negotiations" under Fire in S. Korea
articles.content:
Railroading of "Proposal on Rice Negotiations" under Fire in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) reportedly released a statement on Nov. 23 assailing the "Grand National Party" and the "Uri Party" for passing the humiliating "proposal on rice negotiations" in the end. 
 The statement said that this action is little short of forcing the peasants to die and abandoning the food sovereignty of the nation and, at the same time, sentencing them to death.    
 The political camp's passage of this proposal only hardens the will of all the people in south Korea including peasants, workers, the poor and youths and students to launch joint actions against it, the statement pointed out, declaring that Hanchongryon would also join in the struggle.

articles.title: Torchlight March Medal Instituted in DPRK
articles.content:
Torchlight March Medal Instituted in DPRK 
    Pyongyang, November 27 (KCNA) -- A decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK was promulgated on Nov. 23 to institute a torchlight march medal.
 The torchlight marches staged under the wise leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea were mammoth processions of loyalists as their participants made an epic representation of the undying feats the Party has performed by demonstrating the dignity and honor of the nation to the world holding high the torchlight of Juche kindled on Mt. Paektu and the might of the single-minded unity of all the people firmly united around the headquarters of revolution and the iron faith and will of the young vanguard to make an endless journey for Songun revolution with strong determination following the Party.
 The Presidium of the DPRK SPA institutes the torchlight march medal to commemorate the torchlight marches staged to powerfully demonstrate the sky-high spirit of the people in Songun Korea closely rallied behind the Party and the leader and the revolutionary zeal of the young vanguard to glorify their honor as a shock brigade and the vanguard in the building of a great prosperous powerful socialist nation by holding high the torches to accomplish the cause of Juche and approves the rules for awarding the medal and illustration of the medal, the decree says.

Unionists Call General Strike in South Korea
articles.content:
Unionists Call General Strike in South Korea 
    Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- The "Korean Railway Establishment and Public Corporation Workers' Union" went on a general strike on Nov. 22, according to the south Korean CBS. 
 The union, enraged at the persistent insincere attitude taken by the management side in the negotiations on the three rights of labor that had been under way since February, held a meeting in Kongju City, South Chungchong Province at which it declared it would stage the first phase general strike from Nov. 22.

Authorities' Offer of Land to U.S. Forces in S. Korea under Fire
articles.content:
Authorities' Offer of Land to U.S. Forces in S. Korea under Fire
    Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- The All-People Measure Committee for Checking the Expansion of the U.S. Military Base in Phyongthaek, members of the Phaengsong Township Measure Committee against the Expansion of the U.S. Military Base and inhabitants in Phyongthaek on Nov. 23 staged a protest in Songnam, Kyonggi Province, against the authorities' approval of the resolution on offering land for the transfer and expansion of the U.S. military base in Phyongthaek, according to a news report.
 They held a rally for checking the approval of the resolution in front of the entrance to the "Land Corporation" where a meeting of the "Central Committee for Land Expropriation" was under way. In the meantime, their representatives talked to those concerned over the issue.    
 But the committee held a meeting attended by its members only and passed the resolution, deceiving those representatives.
 Upon hearing the news, representatives from all walks of life, members of civic and public organizations and inhabitants of Phyongthaek stated that it is little short of a death sentence passed to them and occupied the office of the "corporation" where they staged a sit-in strike till late at night.
 Representatives of the All-People Measure Committee held a meeting for urgent measures there and called a press conference there.
 In a press release they demanded the "government" totally reexamine the plan for the expansion of the U.S. military base and threatened to continue the sit-in strike there till their demands have been met.    
 Meanwhile, inhabitants of Phyongthaek held a candlelight meeting in front of the entrance to the "Land Corporation."

National Music and Dance Developed to Meet Modern Tastes in DPRK
articles.content:
National Music and Dance Developed to Meet Modern Tastes in DPRK
    Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- The Korean National Music and Dance Institute is working hard to find out and readjust the excellent heritages of national culture of the Korean people in view of historicism and develop to meet the tastes of the times.
 The institute true to the intention of leader Kim Jong Il is making big efforts to represent folks songs in a new form of playing, keeping alive their own trills. 
 The institute made successful representation of folk songs including "Ryonggangginari", "Jangsangod Tharyong" and "Yangsando" to meet the modern tastes and made progress in the efforts to find out and readjust many folk dance rhythms such as "Girl of Koguryo" and "Dancers of mural paintings" that reflect the desire of the then people and their love for their hometowns and keep them in their origin.    
 It also works hard to find out and preserve the traditional dancing costumes to classify and systematize over 430 dancing costumes of more than one hundred dances in the chronological order and according to dancing pieces. 
 It set forth a book that give the working people and school youth and children a deep understanding of the national music and dance and a book explaining the songs dating back to the period of enlightenment which had been sung imbuing the people with patriotism and the idea of independence in the people despite the Japanese imperialists' moves to obliterate national culture.

Congratulations to German Chancellor
articles.content:
Congratulations to German Chancellor
    Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a congratulatory message to Angela Merkel upon her appointment as German chancellor. 
 Expressing belief that the relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms in various fields in the interests of the two peoples, the message wished her success in her responsible work.    
 Paek Nam Sun, foreign minister of the DPRK, sent a congratulatory message to Frank-Walter Steinmeier upon his appointment as German foreign minister.

articles.title: Congratulations to Sri Lankan PM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Sri Lankan PM
    Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a congratulatory message to Ratnasiri Wickremanawake upon his appointment as Sri Lankan prime minister.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would as ever grow stronger in the mutual interests.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits
    Pyongyang, November 26 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea headed by Kil Sang Bong, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the union, left here today to visit Russia and Poland. 
 Meanwhile, a delegation of the Union of Korean Teachers and School Clerks in Japan headed by Chairman of its Central Committee Ku Tae Sok arrived here today to attend celebrations of the 60th anniversaries of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea and a national meeting of active members of the GFTUK.
